pros: I am a researcher for a professor. pro: let me adjust my schedule
cons: There were no cons to suggest

pros: Supportive colleagues, great opportunities for personal development
cons: You may need to commute if you need luxury housing

pros: I honestly can't think of one.
cons: Poor working conditions, no training available, most of the employees are over the age of 60, no raises unless you are a dean or a vice president, and the town is isolated.  You have no options for eating out.  Personnel files are subjective opinions based on no facts.  The Internet access is sketchy, it may or may not work.  Most of the faculty and the employees may not be qualified to perform their jobs.  Customer service is absent and the basement areas used as storm shelters leak.  What is really alarming about the leaks is the fact that their are electrical wires near them.  Job positions are not usually re-advertised, if a friend or a family member is the only one applies they get the job.  No modern technology is available.  Even if it was there are but a few who can use it, so due them being knowledgeable they are ostracized.

pros: Great atmosphere, plenty of hard working co-workers willing to share shifts or cover if needed. Fantastic leadership, very understanding of scheduling or issues due to conflicts if any occur.
cons: Not enough work at times, days can run slow and cause hours to dip during some weeks. Usually not a problem but it can get stagnant quickly.

pros: I had a friendly working environment. My coworkers were nice. You got to learn a lot on the job.
cons: I was paid minimum wage as a student worker so no bonus or raises. I also could not work over 20 hours a week unless for holidays. Low budget for services needed to perform around campus.

pros: Helping a unique group of young people achieve things they once thought was impossible.
cons: Working for people who suffer from serious mental health issues, having a president that is corrupt and hires friends that are not qualified for the positions they hold.

review_title: The Best Goat Research Institute in the world
job_title: Visiting Research Associate in Langston, OK
pros: The American Institute for Goat Research has outstanding small ruminant research scientists conducting various research on goats and sheep.
cons: There is no salary increase for over 20 years.

job_title: Senior Counselor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: community feeling with co-workers, sense of kinship
cons: no yearly raise or review for advancement or transferring to another position
As of date, I have no complaints.
